definition: oil/fat/grease/petroleum/to apply tung oil, paint or varnish/oily/greasy/glib/cunning
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Early tugboats had steam engines; today diesel engines are used.
sentences.chinese: 早在拖船曾用蒸汽火车头，今天柴油发动机使用。

sentences.english: His diesel engine runs on oil collected from the kitchen of a local pub.
sentences.chinese: 他把当地酒吧的厨房油用在自己的柴油发动机上。

sentences.english: The hybrid would incorporate a low-volume diesel engine to provide propulsion with unlimited range.
sentences.chinese: 这种车有个体积很小的柴油发动机提供无限动力。

sentences.english: The blade of the electric fan is covered with dust.
sentences.chinese: 螺旋桨叶由柴油发动机驱动。

sentences.english: See How Diesel Engines Work for more information.
sentences.chinese: 更多信息见柴油发动机工作原理。

sentences.english: In diesel engines in particular, the oil can thicken by absorbing soot.
sentences.chinese: 特别是在柴油发动机，机油变稠因吸收烟尘。

sentences.english: The diesel engine is reliable and longlasting .
sentences.chinese: 柴油发动机可靠并经久耐用。
水冷，单缸，四冲程，柴油发动机。

sentences.english: DIESEL engines are famously unfussy about what they burn in their cylinders.
sentences.chinese: 柴油发动机向来对汽缸里的燃料毫不挑剔。

definition: discharge volume/engine capacity/engine displacement (volume of air fuel mixture drawn in during one cycle)
